mh: BE documenter agent (yolo-documenter.md) created with backend documentation focus
FE documenter agent (yolo-fe-documenter.md) created with frontend documentation focus
UX documenter agent (yolo-ux-documenter.md) created with design system documentation focus
Each agent gated by documenter config (on_request/always/never)
obj: Create per-department Documenter agents that generate structured documentation artifacts. Each agent is config-gated via documenter setting (on_request = spawn only when user requests, always = spawn every phase, never = skip entirely). Agents produce docs.jsonl artifacts and are read-write within their department boundaries.

a: Create agents/yolo-documenter.md with YAML frontmatter (name: yolo-documenter, description: Backend Documentation agent that produces structured API docs, script usage guides, and architecture decision records, tools: Read/Glob/Grep/Write/Bash, disallowedTools: Edit/EnterPlanMode/ExitPlanMode, model: haiku, maxTurns: 20, permissionMode: acceptEdits, memory: project). Agent body: (1) Hierarchy: Department Backend, reports to Lead, spawned after Code Review (Step 8) and before QA (Step 9); (2) Persona & Voice: Technical Writer archetype — clear, concise, user-first documentation; (3) Config Gate: only spawned when config documenter != 'never'. If documenter='on_request', spawned only when user explicitly asks. If documenter='always', spawned every phase; (4) Documentation Protocol: reads summary.jsonl + code-review.jsonl + modified files, produces docs.jsonl with entries: {type: 'api'|'script'|'adr'|'changelog', path: string, content: string, section: string}; (5) Output: docs.jsonl to phase directory, commit: docs({phase}): documentation; (6) BE scope: script usage (--help flags), API endpoint docs, ADR extraction from decisions.jsonl, CHANGELOG entries; (7) dir_isolation: writes to docs/ and .yolo-planning/phases/ only; (8) Effort: turbo=skip, fast=changelog only, balanced=changelog+api, thorough=full docs.
v: File exists, has valid YAML frontmatter with name: yolo-documenter and model: haiku, body contains 'Config Gate' section and 'docs.jsonl'

a: Create agents/yolo-fe-documenter.md with YAML frontmatter (name: yolo-fe-documenter, description: Frontend Documentation agent for component docs, prop tables, state flow diagrams, and Storybook-style usage examples, tools: Read/Glob/Grep/Write, disallowedTools: Edit/Bash/EnterPlanMode/ExitPlanMode, model: haiku, maxTurns: 20, permissionMode: acceptEdits, memory: project). Agent body: (1) Hierarchy: Department Frontend, reports to FE Lead; (2) Persona & Voice: Frontend Documentation Specialist; (3) Config Gate: same documenter config gate as BE; (4) Documentation Protocol: reads summary.jsonl + component source + design-tokens.jsonl, produces docs.jsonl; (5) FE scope: component API docs (props/events/slots), state flow documentation, Storybook-style usage examples, design token usage guide, a11y checklist per component; (6) dir_isolation: writes to docs/ and .yolo-planning/phases/ only; (7) No Bash — documentation is analysis-only.
v: File exists, has valid YAML frontmatter with name: yolo-fe-documenter and model: haiku, body contains 'component' and 'props'

a: Create agents/yolo-ux-documenter.md with YAML frontmatter (name: yolo-ux-documenter, description: UI/UX Documentation agent for design system docs, token catalogs, interaction specs, and handoff guides, tools: Read/Glob/Grep/Write, disallowedTools: Edit/Bash/EnterPlanMode/ExitPlanMode, model: haiku, maxTurns: 20, permissionMode: acceptEdits, memory: project). Agent body: (1) Hierarchy: Department UI/UX, reports to UX Lead; (2) Persona & Voice: Design System Documentation Specialist; (3) Config Gate: same documenter config gate as BE; (4) Documentation Protocol: reads design-tokens.jsonl + component-specs.jsonl + user-flows.jsonl, produces docs.jsonl; (5) UX scope: design token catalog (color palette, typography scale, spacing system), component interaction specs, user flow documentation, handoff guide for FE team, a11y compliance summary; (6) dir_isolation: writes to docs/ and .yolo-planning/phases/ only; (7) No Bash — documentation is analysis-only.
v: File exists, has valid YAML frontmatter with name: yolo-ux-documenter and model: haiku, body contains 'design token' and 'handoff'

a: Create scripts/resolve-documenter-gate.sh — determines whether Documenter agent should spawn based on config. Takes flags: --config <path> --trigger <phase|on_request>. Logic: (1) Read documenter value from config via jq (default: 'on_request'); (2) If documenter='never': exit 1 (do not spawn); (3) If documenter='always': exit 0 (spawn); (4) If documenter='on_request' AND trigger='on_request': exit 0; (5) If documenter='on_request' AND trigger='phase': exit 1 (do not auto-spawn). Output JSON: {spawn: true|false, reason: string}. set -u minimum.
v: File exists, is executable, contains set -u, reads documenter config via jq, exits 0 when documenter=always
